result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Travis L. Christjohn

records.addlTxt: 11:22 AM Room 301 Defendant Travis L. Christjohn not in court. Attorney Wright C. Laufenberg not in court.  Attorney Kelly L Hays in court for State of Wisconsin. State received communication from victim to modify no contact. State asks to modifies to no abusive contact with victim. Court modifies no violent or abusive contact with victim.  (Copy of minutes given to sheriff's dept.)

2:21 PM Defendant Travis L. Christjohn in court.  Attorney Wright C. Laufenberg in court for Travis L. Christjohn.  Attorney Kelly L Hays in court for State of Wisconsin. Atty Laufenberg has copy of complaint, waives reading and waivers time limits for p.h. Def. agrees to waive time limits for p.h.  Court accepts waiver. State heard on bond conditions.  Atty Laufenberg needs to talk to defendant. Court will modify contact via electronic mean only for child care & custody.  Copy of minutes given to jail.
Status conference scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 11:00 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
Adjustment Number: 22A 024699,
Payable Number: 66439,
Receipt Number: 22R 002684,
Amount: $20.00

2:46 PM Defendant Travis L. Christjohn in court.  Attorney Kelly L Hays in court for State of Wisconsin. Court reviews history of case.  Def. is seeking counsel.  Bond continues.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

1:15 PM in Room 301. Defendant Travis L. Christjohn appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Kelly L Hays in court for State of Wisconsin. All appearances are by Zoom. Def. has copy of complaint, advised of charges and penalties.  Def. given atty rights and given 3 options, PD, hire own or court appointed atty. Def. will hire own attny. State heard on bond, recommends $1,000 cash bond with conditions maintain absolute sobriety. No illegal use or possession of controlled substances No presence in establishments with Class B liquor license. No contact with victim or her residence.  The Court orders $1,000 cash bond with conditions as requested.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
